intro: Cryptocarya lenticellata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Australia, particularly found in the eastern regions of the country. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in small, raised pores called lenticels. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Cryptocarya lenticellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
